result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly Ryal Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
All applicable costs and surcharges to be paid by 3.16.15 or a civil judgment is ordered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 3.16.15 or a civil judgment is ordered.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelly Ryal Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant Kelly Ryal Jones in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Kelly Ryal Jones in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel newly appointed.  Just met defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 7.  Court vacates 1-26-2015 jury trial.  Motion hearing scheduled for 01-15-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Richard J. Johnson in court, defendant Kelly Ryal Jones not in court, in custody.  N. Sheldon for  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 47 and jury trial . lr

to Suppress Defendant's Statements received and filed. sab

Defendant Kelly Ryal Jones in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Kelly Ryal Jones in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant wanted to enter a plea, but maintained he didn't possess the weapon. Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 9/12/2014 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 10/8/2014 at 9:00 am.   Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.

Attorney Richard J Johnson in court, defendant Kelly Ryal Jones not in court, in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Parties are still in negotiations. Case rescheduled for PLEA and SENTENCING on 7/2/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Letter from defendant received and filed.

Attorney Richard J Johnson in court, defendant Kelly Ryal Jones not in court, in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 6/3/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 3-31-2014 received and filed. (11 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Attorney Richard Johnson 819 N 6th Street Milwaukee WI
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Kelly Ryal Jones in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Kelly Ryal Jones in custody.  Karyn Behling for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Michael Alles-MPD Detective.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #07CF2851 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kelly Ryal Jones in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Kelly Ryal Jones in custody.  Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
